questionData.ques: What best describes how the police initially got involved in your case?

optnArry.text: The police pulled you over in a traffic stop
You drove up to a police "RIDE" spotcheck
You were involved in a traffic  accident
You were sleeping/sitting in an unmoving vehicle and police came up to you
Police came to your house and you were already inside

questionData.ques: At the time the police first spoke to you, how many people were in your vehicle?

optnArry.text: You were by yourself in the vehicle.
There was one passenger in the front passenger seat.
There were multiple people in my vehicle.

questionData.ques: Were you in the driver’s seat of the vehicle, or were you somewhere else in the vehicle when the police arrived?

optnArry.text: Somewhere else (i.e. passenger seat, back seat, trunk…)

questionData.ques: When the police arrived at the accident were you in your vehicle or standing outside the vehicle?
While you were at home – after driving but before the police arrived. Did you drink alcohol?
After speaking to you, did the police

optnArry.text: ask you to provide a breath sample at the roadside into a small handheld breathalyser
optnArry.subQues: Did the officer already have the handheld breathalyser with him or in his car?

subQuesArr.text: He had it with him or he got it within a couple minutes.
He didn't have it with him and we had to wait more than 5 minutes for one to arrive.

optnArry.text: Tell you that you were under arrest without making you blow into the small handheld breathalyser at the roadside.

questionData.ques: Prior to you dealing with police, did you drink a large quantity of alcohol in the 5en dash10 minutes before you met the officer?

optnArry.subQues: Did you tell the officer about this recent drinking

questionData.ques: You blew into a small handheld breathalyser at the roadside. Did you:

optnArry.text: Blow a result other than “Fail” but the police officer arrested you anyway.
Provide several breath samples but not get a ‘proper reading’ and then get charged for refusing to provide a suitable breath sample.

questionData.ques: Please indicate what time the following things happened:

optnArry.text: The police officer first saw you at what time?
The police officer first spoke to you how many minutes later?
After the officer first spoke to you, how many minutes went by before he or she arrested you?
After you were arrested, how many minutes went by before the officer told you about your right to speak to a lawyer?
After that, how many more minutes did it take before you were driven away from the scene in the police car?

questionData.ques: When the police told you at the roadside that you had the right to speak to a lawyer was he she reading it, or telling it to you from memory?

optnArry.text: He she read from a book or card.
He/she told me this verbally only.
He/she never told me I had the right to speak to a lawyer while we were at the roadside.

questionData.ques: When the police told you at the roadside that you had the right to speak to a lawyer was he/she reading it, or telling it to you from memory?
How long did it take to travel from the scene of you being arrested to the police station?
questionData.secondQues: Did that time seem appropriate, or did it take much longer than it should have?

questionData.ques: Once you arrived at the police station were you able to go inside right away or did you have to wait?

optnArry.text: Had to wait (i.e. for police station garage to open)
optnArry.subQues: How long did you have to wait?

questionData.ques: Did you speak to a lawyer at the police station?

subQuesArr.text: you are not given a chance by the police there
You dd not know any and told the police it was o.
You tried to reach a lawyer but nobody answered.

questionData.ques: Were you satisfied that the lawyer you spoke to gave you decent advice?

optnArry.subQues: [Did you express your dissatisfaction to the police?]?

subQuesArr.text: Yes, but you did not get to speak to another lawyer?
Yes, and you did get to speak to another lawyer.

questionData.ques: How long after you arrived at the police station did you get to speak to a lawyer?
questionData.secondQues: Approximately how long was the call?

questionData.ques: After you finished speaking to a lawyer, approximately how long was it before you were brought to the room with the breathalyser?
During the process of providing breath samples into the breathalyser at the police station did anything strange happen?
What were your breath readings, and at what time were they taken?
After you had been arrested, but before you gave breath samples at the police station did you drink any alcohol (i.e. hidden flask)
Did any police officer make any of these comments to you while you were with police?

optnArry.text: They (the police) saw you driving erratically.
You appeared to be unsteady on your feet.

questionData.ques: Do you think any of these things are true:

optnArry.text: They (the police) saw you driving erratically.
You appeared to be unsteady on your feet.

questionData.ques: Do you have explanations to any of the following?

optnArry.text: They (the police) saw you driving erratically.
You appeared to be unsteady on your feet.

questionData.ques: Did you receive any bad treatment during your time in police custody?

optnArry.text: You were denied use of a bathroom.
You were given access to a toilet that was under video surveillance.
Police did not let you check a cell phone, or call a friend to get the name of a lawyer.

questionData.ques: The police ultimately charged you with?
You were released how long after you finished the breathalyser testing
